summary: Regencell Bioscience Holdings Limited, a penny stock as recently as April, is worth nearly $30 billion in market value . A year ago, the stock had a market capitalization of just $53 million . This is despite the company having a net loss of $4.4 million for its fiscal year that ended June 2024 .  Hong Kong-based firm Regencell debuted on the Nasdaq Capital Market in 2021 . Firm aims to treat neurological disorders like ADHD and autism spectrum disorder through traditional herb-based medicines .  Regencell said data from a 2022 trial showed the treatment was effective in reducing and eliminating Covid symptoms within six days . The firm has funded its operations so far, primarily from shareholder loans and proceeds from its initial public offering . Of its nearly 500 million outstanding shares, only about 30 million are available to be traded .  CEO Yat-Gai Au’s ownership accounts for 86% of Regencell shares . Tesla Inc. has 87% of the remaining shares, according to holding data compiled by Bloomberg .

Tesla (TSLA) has got the proverbial “kitchen sink’ thrown at it with a plethora of reputational issues and controversies, soft car sales, tariff impacts, and missed deadlines . Some of the problems that the Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) stock has faced include: Elon Musk Reputation . Tesla sales have fallen across key markets like Europe and China over the past few years while profit margins have declined .  TSLA shares are up about 75% over the past twelve months, trouncing the S&P 500’s 9.3% gains . Tesla faces competition from subsidized Chinese competitors likeLi Auto (LI), Nio (NIO),andBYD (BYDDY)  Waymo aims to manufacture 2,000 Waymo vehicles over the next year . Tesla currently produces roughly one million Model Y, FSD-capable vehicles per year . Unlike Tesla, Waymo relies on expensive lidar technology .  Tesla’s manufacturing capability is a core differentiator vs Waymo, who faces vehicle production constraints . No other incumbent US or European carmaker offers full self-driving capabilities on city roads . Tesla has significant advantages including cost, scalability, and autonomous technology .  LI Sponsored ADR (LI) Inc. Inc. is a sponsor of a company that has been in the news for more than a decade . LI's sponsor of the company has been a long-term success in the U.S.

President Donald Trump and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have an odd-couple relationship . Trump has made it clear that he wants to cut support for electric vehicles, if not generally reduce environmental protections . Musk owns a company that builds electric cars . The only loser would be Tesla .  Interest in Tesla among Canadians with intentions of buying an electric vehicle has fallen to 13 per cent from 29 a year ago . The survey doesn't get into the reasons Canadians are turning their backs on Tesla, but Musk’s politics are likely the key driver .  The danger for Tesla is that customers don’t need the drama or misery . Trump for years has openly berated EVs, so it’s not like his supporters would be swayed by the tacky sales pitch .  According to the J.D. Power survey, Hyundai was the top brand, with 36 per cent of Canadian EV shoppers interested . It's hard to fathom how Musk, an intelligent individual, did not see this coming .

Tuopu shares surged 56% through February on enthusiasm for humanoid robotics but later dropped 44% after weak Q1 earnings and tariff-related concerns . The stock is down 5% year to date, underperforming the CSI 300 index's 2% decline .

Tesla announced the launch of new Model S and Model X vehicles late Thursday . The new models come with a package of design and performance upgrades, along with a reported $5,000 price hike . The Model S comes with up to 410 miles of range, making it the company's longest-range vehicle to date .  Elon Musk and President Donald Trump sent Tesla shares spiraling . Elon Musk is CEO of the electric car company . Tesla's stock price has slumped to a record low of $1 billion .

ThePickup 01 from Guangzhou Automobile Group debuted in Shanghai with some jaw-dropping features . At just $41,000, it's already being compared to Tesla's Cybertruck . The Pickup 01 has a steering wheel that slides from one side of the dash to the other .  Steer-by-wire steering wheel eliminates a heavy column, frees cabin space, and slashes tooling for export markets with opposite-side traffic . Adaptive chassis flexes or stiffens on demand, letting the truck hop from gravel to tarmac while passengers barely notice .  Tesla prices its entry-level Cybertruck at $62,490 on the officialorder page, giving GAC's sticker a 33% discount . Production of the Pickup 01 isscheduled for 2027, with pilot fleets bound for Australia, Saudi Arabia, and Latin America .  Americans think you need to be considered wealthy to be called rich . Americans also think you should be a millionaire . Get the latest stock analysis from Benzinga.com .

Tesla revamps its Model S sedan and Model X SUV . New features include Frost Blue paint option, redesigned wheels aimed at boosting efficiency . Price hikes for all configurations of the two models by $5,000 .  Lucid GroupLCID engineered the Lucid Air as a direct competitor to the Tesla Model S . Lucid Gravity, Rivian R1S byRivianRIVN is also a close contender of Model X . TSLA carries a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) at present . The updated models are available to order immediately with estimated delivery times of two to four weeks .  Tesla has underperformed the Zacks Automotive - Domestic industry year to date . The Rivian R1S is priced at $75,900, far lower than the all-wheel drive Model X . TSLA shares have lost 19.4% compared with the industry’s decline of 18.9% .  Rivian Automotive, Inc. (RIVN) is one of the leading automakers in the automotive industry . Rivian automaker has been on the decline for the past year .

Shares of this electric car maker have returned -7.1% over the past month versus the Zacks S&P 500 composite's +1.7% change . The Zacks Automotive - Domestic industry, to which Tesla belongs, has lost 2.8% over this period .  Tesla is expected to post earnings of $0.43 per share for the current quarter, indicating a change of -17.3% from the year-ago quarter . The Zacks Consensus Estimate has changed +7.8% over the last 30 days . A higher fair value than the current market price drives investors' interest in buying the stock, leading to its price moving higher .  Over the past month, the estimate has changed -0.3% of what Tesla is expected to report a year ago . The size of the recent change in the consensus estimate, along with three other factors related to earnings estimates, has resulted in a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) for Tesla .  Tesla reported revenues of $19.34 billion in the last reported quarter, representing a year-over-year change of -9.2% . The company topped consensus revenue estimates just once over the last four quarters . The $96.69 billion and $114.19 billion estimates for the current and next fiscal years indicate changes of -1% and +18.1% .  Comparing the current value of a company's valuation multiples to its own historical values helps ascertain whether its stock is fairly valued, overvalued, or undervalued . Tesla is graded F on this front, indicating it is trading at a premium to its peers .  Tesla's Zacks Rank #5 suggests that it may underperform the broader market in the near term . The market buzz about Tesla on Zacks.com might help determine whether or not it's worthwhile paying attention to the market buzz .

Tesla raises prices for its Model S and Model X vehicles in the U.S. by $5,000 . The updated Model S all-wheel drive now starts at $84,990, while the high-performance Plaid version is listed at $99,990 . The price increase comes as Tesla rolls out enhancements to both luxury models .

Sales of Tesla vehicles in the U.S. fell 16% in April, marking the first year-on-year drop in EV sales for 14 months . With a share of 40%, even the slightest weakness at Elon Musk’s company has a disproportionate effect on monthly EV sales . Chevrolet saw its business triple on the back of the new Equinox crossover .  Even in its currently weakened state, Tesla still accounts for roughly four out of every 10 EVs sold in the United States, versus market shares of below 10% for its two closest rivals—Chevrolet and Ford . Even the slightest declines have a disproportionately large effect on the overall market .  Tesla’s poor results in the U.S. in April confirm a trend that had already emerged in China . Sales are already down 13% in the first quarter, and June needs to be a very strong month to at least eke out stagnant volumes .  Tesla's political activism has also provoked a customer boycott . “Don’t worry about it,” Tesla CEO said when asked about the slump in sales, “They’re fine”

The luxury electric vehicles (EV) market is on a rapid growth trajectory, with forecasts indicating a surge in market value from USD 202.3 billion in 2025 to USD 1.04 trillion by 2034, achieving a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 20.0%. The expansion is driven by a fusion of environmental consciousness and advanced technology .  Tesla’s diversification into autonomous vehicles and humanoid robots could rapidly transform its revenue model, enhancing profitability . Big Tech has led the furious rebound in US stocks from the tailspin that followed President Trump’s sweeping April 2 tariff edict . Now options traders are signaling that they see the pricey cohort as especially vulnerable to another round of trade war-driven volatility . The cost of protecting against a correction in the Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1 exchange-traded fund is climbing .  Tech behemoths fell harder than the broad market during the early April turmoil . Some investors see a threat that it could happen again . High valuations, and economic impacts of the tariffs, are still worries, expert says .  Bloomberg’s Magnificent Seven gauge is trading at 29 times projected profits, above a 10-year average of 28 . Earlier this month, Needham analysts downgraded Apple's stock to a hold rating . The uptick in demand for hedges underscores investor doubts about staying power of the current rally .  Climate Pledges, Is There a Silver Lining? Tesla's stock is back above a trillion-dollar market capitalization, but the company is struggling to sell cars . The company is claiming big things with robotaxis and robotics, but with little to show for it yet . Next few years are crucial for Tesla and the long-term trajectory of its stock price, currently at a current market value of $1 trillion .  Tesla's U.S. market share of new EV sales has dropped to 43.5% compared to 75% at the start of 2022 . The company is getting pummeled by local players likeBYD, which now sells more cars globally than Tesla . Tesla's automotive revenue sank 20% year over year last quarter .  Tesla has promised for years an expansion away from just EV sales . Elon Musk has claimed for a decade that self-driving Tesla vehicles are just around the corner from being released to the public . The company's battery pack business generated $2.7 billion in revenue last quarter and growing 67% year over year .  A lot of Tesla's stock price is betting on the future potential of its robotics initiatives . Elon Musk recently claimed that robotics could help Tesla's market cap get to $30 trillion . But investors need to back off this optimism and return to reality .  At a price-to-earnings ratio (P/E) of 175, Tesla stock looks like a poor bet for investors today . My prediction is more pain for shareholders in the years to come . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late .  There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Tesla is one of three stocks that could be worth $1.5 billion . The Motley Fool has invested in Tesla and other companies .

Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) is an electric vehicle company accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy . Tesla's scale advantage in EV production leads to gross margins that exceed incumbents such as General Motors and Ford .  Tesla is trading at $326.92 per share, or 124.6x forward price-to-earnings . The energy segment is the most profitable and fastest-growing business line for the company . The company's execution ability is a question mark given its long history of delays .  RadNet’s stock price of $55.30 implies a valuation ratio of 104.7x forward P/E . Smaller revenue base of $1.87 billion means it hasn’t achieved economies of scale that some industry juggernauts enjoy .  Donald Trump’s victory in the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election sent major indices to all-time highs, but stocks have retraced as investors debate the health of the economy and the potential impact of tariffs . Tesla bulls have recently defended the 50- and 200-day moving averages in a move that has coincided with the relative strength index reclaiming its neutral threshold to signal a recovery in price momentum . Investors should watch key support levels on Tesla's chart around $265 and $215, while also monitoring important resistance levels near $365 and $430 .  Tesla shares have risen more than 50% from their early-April low . The stock is still down about 20% since the start of the year amid concerns overslowing EU salesand uncertainty over the Trump administration’s tariff policies .  Selling below the key moving averages could see the shares initially retrace to around $265 . This area would likely provide support near the early Aprilcountertrendhigh . The shares may face overhead selling pressure in this location near the rising wedge pattern’s peak . Buy above this level could see Tesla's stock climb toward $430 .  Prices may seek to lock in profits near a range of corresponding trading activity on the chart that formed just below the stock'sall-time high . The author does not own any of the above securities .

Tesla stock has trailed the market for a few years now . Its electric vehicle business is declining and its new initiatives are risky and have no proven track record of success . Down around 14% this year, investors are beginning to doubt Elon Musk and Tesla stock again .  Last quarter, Tesla's total EV deliveries fell 13% year over year to 337,000 . Over the last 12 months, Tesla posted $7 billion in operating income, down 50% from all-time highs . The bulk of Tesla's past stock performance has come from its EV division .  Tesla's EV business is in a terrible spot in 2025, which is why investors are beginning to doubt the stock again . Tesla hopes to build a self-driving taxi network similar to Waymo, although details are not clear today . Elon Musk originally said it would debut a Tesla robotaxi in Austin on June 12 but has since revised this to June 22 .  Critics of Tesla's approach to autonomous driving point to its use of cameras instead of LIDAR technology . A robotaxi network has huge economic promise, not to mention a giant value proposition for society in the way of safer roads and automating a boring and time-consuming task . We already have a leading, self-driving company: Waymo .  Tesla is an EV manufacturer with falling sales, declining margins, and increasing competition globally . At a trillion-dollar market cap, Tesla has a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 178 . This is pricing in huge earnings growth for the company when its earnings are currently moving in the wrong direction . Buying Tesla stock would not be a smart decision for investors this year .
